title: What’s Happening in Space Policy September 22-28, 2024
summary: Here is SpacePolicyOnline.com’s list of space policy events for the week of September 22-28, 2024 and any insight we can offer about them. The House and Senate are in session...

title: U.S. Space Command’s commercial operations group gets expanded role
summary: The Joint Task Force-Space Defense Commercial Operations cell is broadening its focus beyond space tracking to battlefield intelligence

title: House to Take Up 2024 NASA Authorization Bill Next Week
summary: House Majority Leader Steve Scalise’s schedule for floor action next week includes consideration of the 2024 NASA Authorization Act.  The bipartisan bill cleared the House Science, Space, and Technology Committee...

title: NASA creates space sustainability division to consolidate orbital debris activities
summary: NASA has established a space sustainability division that will consolidate much of the work the agency is doing on orbital debris and related issues.

title: Electron launches second set of Kinéis satellites
summary: An Electron launched a second set of satellites for French startup Kinéis Sept. 20, putting that company on track to begin offering Internet of Things services.

title: Evolving artificial intelligence capabilities in space
summary: Executives discussing emerging space-based computing capabilities Sept. 20 called for stronger collaboration between policymakers and technology leaders to accelerate artificial intelligence’s societal benefits.

title: SpaceX sends 20 more Starlink satellites to orbit in successful launch
summary: SpaceX sent 20 additional Starlink satellites to orbit in yet another successful launch, this time from Vandenberg Space Force Base in California....

title: ARMD Solicitations
summary: This ARMD solicitations page compiles the opportunities to collaborate with NASA’s aeronautical innovators and/or contribute to their research to enable new and improved air transportation systems. A summary of available opportunities with key dates requiring action are listed first. More information about each opportunity is detailed lower on this page. title: One company appears to be thriving as part of NASA’s return to the Moon
summary: "This has really been a transformational year for us."

title: NASA Awards $1.5 Million at Watts on the Moon Challenge Finale
summary: NASA has awarded a total of $1.5 million to two U.S. teams for their novel technology solutions addressing energy distribution, management, and storage as part of the agency’s Watts on the Moon Challenge. The innovations from this challenge aim to support NASA’s Artemis missions, which will establish long-term human presence on the Moon. This two-phase […]
